reviews.title: Great Staff!
reviews.text: Beautiful resort! The staff was wonderful! Our only complaint was that our room seemed to attract alot of noise in the morning, particularly banging, which seemed to be coming from housekeeping. I guess we could have said something, but everything else was perfect, so we just let it go. We would reccomend this hotel to anyone, we can't wait to go back!

reviews.title: Great Hotel and an Excellent Time
reviews.text: We just returned from 4 nights at Rincon Beach Resort, and wish we were able to stay a few more evenings. We flew into San Juan because no direct flights were offered to the smaller and closer airport in Aguadilla from our hometown; and we were disappointed in the longer than anticipated drive out to Rincon due to highway traffic and congestion. I recommend Aguadilla if possible if you are staying in Rincon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The roadways and infrastructure are certainly Carribbean in nature and different from our comfort level at home, so the drive in was overwhelming. Once we checked into our very nice and clean ocean view room and sat down for a drink, we were able to finally relax and take in our surroundings. Our bartender took a lot of time to sketch out an excellent map of good places to check out nearby, since the immediate area outside of the resort is a little rougher than other vacations we've been on. Additionally, the hotel stands alone, and is not surrounded by a strip of other hotels or resorts. With his advice and a decent meal at the hotel restaurant, we had calmed down and started our vacation.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is modern and clean, although a little emptier guest-wise than we had expected. The pool is great, as is the swimup bar, cabana grill for lunch, and the beach itself (which was clean and secluded so that only hotel guests used it). Some more luxary amenities such as spa treatments, concierge, exercise classes and more active beach bar service were lacking, possibly due to the resort only being 1/2 full while we were staying, but we usually try to avoid taking advantage of those amenities wherever we go and didn't miss them. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful; and as I said, the entire place was modern, clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: Not what I was waiting for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Compare notes between the staff and other visitors and you'll be directed toward some excellent restaurants in Rincon for dinner. You'll definitely need a rental car because I didn't see taxis anywhere. Driving is a little hectic, but take your time and it is not all that rough. We took a memorable trip to the Arecibo Observatory that brought us into some more intense driving situations well off the beaten path for which we should have planned better.
reviews.title: paradise found

likes.liked: — you really felt like you were at home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled on business
reviews.text: We loved the place for what it was, a beautiful hotel where you really can have an excellent time relaxing and doing nothing. If you are looking for an intense service-oriented resort experience with pushy staff trying to wait on you hand and foot, this probably isn't for you. If you appreciate great resorts like that but prefer to do things on your own at your own pace, this place is great.
reviews.title: Great resort with private beach

likes.disliked: — Limited on-site facilities for business travelers

reviews.title: Excellent Beach Location for everyone
reviews.text: We just returned from a 4-day stay at RBR over the Thanksgiving weekend. I had read all previous reviews and couldn't decide between this property and Rincon of the Seas, but the fact the RBR had refrigerators tipped the scales for us, with three children, ages 8, 3, and 1. This is a prime beach location, with the beach only steps away from any of the rooms, and the infinity pool very conveniently located at the edge of the sand, with a boardwalk separating the pool and beach. The water in the sea was calm and warm, and the pool and hot tub were ideally situated. Despite the holiday weekend, we felt that it was not very crowded. We were able to reserve shaded beach chairs both on the boardwalk (next to the pool) and on the beach itself, near the water. By Sunday afternoon, we felt like we were the only ones there--in fact there were only eight cars in the parking lot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another reviewer here wrote that this hotel is nice, but “the wrong vibe for Rincon”. Before our trip, I didn’t understand this statement…what could ever be wrong about a nice hotel?
reviews.title: Great view, service so-so

likes.liked: — Nice pool and beach, great sunsets
likes.disliked: — Needs better level of service from staff for vacationers

reviews.title: Needs service help!
reviews.text: Having spent three nights there in early February, I now understand. My husband and I are also inclined to agree with other reviewers that the service level of this hotel is lacking in proportion to what you pay. In fact, he suggested I title this review “All Fluff and No Stuff”.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007
reviews.text: We had no specific problems…our room was clean, comfortable and everything functioned the way it should. It was more that the hotel didn’t seem geared toward people who had come to enjoy a Caribbean vacation. For example, it wasn’t possible to get an alcoholic beverage before the poolside restaurant opened at lunchtime and again between the time it closed and the lobby bar opened in the evening. In fact, the first two days we were there, the swim-up bar didn’t open at all because all the other guests besides us were there for a sales meeting and spent their days in conference rooms instead of at the pool. Finally, as the weekend approached, more vacationers arrived and we started to feel more of a relaxed vibe like the Caribbean to which we’re accustomed. Then, we did start to really enjoy this hotel, especially its beautiful pool and drop-dead gorgeous sunsets.
reviews.title: bad service, beautiful sunsets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So would I stay here again? The pool itself was really nice, the beachfront was the nicest of any I saw in Rincon and our room itself was nice. But if I returned to Rincon Beach Resort, to be honest it would be wth lowered expectations.
reviews.title: Short on delivery

likes.disliked: — Overall very poor customer service, but we found that to be the case across Puerto Rico.

reviews.title: Five-star prices, three-star hotel
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel, there was no bellstaff, and they told us, as well as many others, that we had to wait for our rooms. We waited until 3:45. We had no where to go, as Rincon has little to see and do. Though our 2-suite was spacious, and the kitchen was very nice, there were bugs crawling on the counter and no pot holders or kitchen towels. They did have flatware and pots/pans, and dishes, though. While on the small beach, they didn't have waitstaff to offer food and drinks; the nice bar tender had to do it all. They also closed the pool bar at 4:00 and the outdoor cafe at 2:00; therefore, you could not eat or drink again until 5:00 when the lobby bar opened with the almost rude bartender. They had told us that you could get snorkeling trips from the hotel and that was not true. They need a activities on the premeise besides sitting and playing the large chess game they have. The SMALL putting green needed repair, as did many of the umbrellas by the pool. As we left, and we were carring our own luggage (my husband had fallen and had a knee brace on), an employee squeezed by us without offering to help. I gues we were able to save money on tipping! I would not return because they didn't seem to care if we, or othere, were there or not. Very unimpressed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family thoroughly enjoyed our 2 nights here, the first week of January. We were worried the hotel might be crowded since there is no school the first week of the year due to the "3 Kings Day" holiday. It was very quiet Wed and Thr and started filling up on Friday.
reviews.title: As Promised!
Not bad, but we're sure we could find a better place for the same cost
reviews.text: The hotel was as promised. Great pool, beach and very clean rooms. The fact that the rooms are all ocean view was a nice surprise! We would have liked a coffee maker in the room, but housekeeping did give us one when asked (they only seem to have a few). The A/C smelled musty, and toiletries in the bathroom would have been nice. All minor complaints, but they would have been major had we paid a rate of $250 nt.

reviews.title: Disappointment
reviews.text: This hotel would be a $250 per night value in San Juan, but I wouldn't want to pay over $150 due to the distance from San Juan. Tip: You aren't allowed to bring coolers onto the resort grounds, but there are refrigerators in the rooms. If you have clear plastic cups, you can pop up to the room for a cheaper refill of your favorite beverage vs. paying the poolside bar prices.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall, the aesthetic s of the resort was very nice. Beautiful part of Puerto Rico. The rooms could've been cleaner (especially the bathroom) and the music went much too late on Saturday night. The mornings were very noisy too - lots of banging and we could hear someone on the treadmill each morning - which was extremely annoying.
reviews.title: I started missing it before we left.....

likes.liked: — Too many things to designate just one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drinks at the bar were outrageously high priced, so we headed north into Rincon where we could purchase our own beer and wine - very cheaply!
reviews.title: Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I just returned from a stay here on June 18-20th with 3 other travelers who were in their 20s. I am a frequent, somewhat discriminating traveler, with this being my 3rd trip to PR. This facility was a nice suprise. First tip: as already stated by other reviews, you definitely need a car! I got a great deal through Hotwire. The hotel was immaculate. We arrived at the hotel at 1 a.m. and the hotel had our rooms waiting for us. The front desk was extremely helpful and pleasant. The beach is just lovely! It is very private and the hotel was pretty empty so there was not much activity, which is what we were looking for. Just relaxing on the beach was fabulous. If you are looking for tons of stuff to do, this might not be the place for you. We did not eat at the hotel, in part because the facility did not offer full menus due to the fact that the hotel was so empty. However, we got some good recommendations that we tried that worked out well for us. If you take 115 to 402 to Rte. 2, there is a McDonalds, Walgreens and a place called Bonanza Supermercado. It is a supermarket with a cafeteria counter inside with some of the yummiest food we ate! And it was very reasonably priced. Also, if you exit 115 to your left from the resort, there is a place on your left called Panaderia, which had some yummy breakfast. Further up on your right, there is a restuarant called Rincon Tropical - the most authentic food we are there! And again, reasonably priced. Check-out was a breeze and parking was free. All in all, a good place for hanging out and relaxing!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Beautiful Beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend an I thought that the 30 minute taxi ride from Aguadilla to RBR was fair at 35 dollars. That was until we took a round trip ride into town from the resort for 20 dollars round trip, which is less than 10 minutes away. The front desk attendant informed us that taxis could be difficult and the nothing was in walking distance. After the first day at RBR every couple or family that you met had taken a trip into town to buy their own beer/liquor and snacks. So if you are looking to lounge at a resort for your entire trip with below average food then RBR will be fine. If you plan on experiencing some of the local culture and food then figure on the extra "tourist" tax.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but you will need a rental car.

likes.disliked: — food from the 2 restaurant kitchens onsite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just spent 6 days here, from May 4 to May 10. We were supposed to leave on the 9th, but we loved it so much we decided to stay another night. We're a couple in our 30s with a 3-year-old boy. We had a deluxe ocean-view room on the first floor, so we walked out the patio
reviews.title: We loved this place!

likes.disliked: — gift shop not open enough, pool bar closed early if it wasn't busy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: door, and were steps from the pool. The place was lovely, the ocean was calm and beautiful (and warmer than the pool), and the pool was great. Over the weekend it was busy with lots of families, plus there
reviews.title: Nice & relaxing..better have a rental car!

likes.liked: — Great beach far from SanJuan's casinos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: was a wedding held in the courtyard, which was pretty noisy Saturday night. Once Sunday afternoon came though, the place cleared out, and for the next 4 days we practically had the place to ourselves. We hear that May is the off season though. We ate dinner at the restaurant once. It was good, but a bit overpriced. We ate breakfast there every day, and found the buffet to be just right for us--bagels, pastries, fruit, yogurt, various juices, and our son ate for free. It was about $20 for the two of us, not including tip. We usually ate lunch at the poolside Pelican Grill, which was fine. Nothing fancy. The waitresses and the cook were super friendly. It usually closed around 4:00 or 5:00 though. The pool bar was nice too (great pina coladas, better than at the Pelican Grill), although it closed a little early during the week when it wasn't busy. The male American bartender was really nice. The female local, a bit standoffish, but she warmed up after a while. The staff at the front desk was especially helpful and courteous, especially Borjas. They had good restaurant suggestions. We usually left the resort to eat dinner. Calypso Cafe, Tamboo, Lazy Parrot, all in Rincon were good. All are about a 10-15 minute ride into town. Also Happy Belly's in Isabella (about a 45-minute drive), decent food, great location.
reviews.title: Secluded Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Having stayed at about a half-dozen different resorts in the Caribbean (on as many different islands), this is the nicest beach I've ever stayed on - for sheer breadth and lack of development surrounding it.
reviews.title: Great Beach!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: This isn't a white sand beach (tending more toward khaki) but you can walk a far stretch in either direction without encountering any other resorts. Because of that lack of development, despite the fact we were there in high season, we never felt crowded. The water is calm and there is no sea grass or rock to encounter.
reviews.title: Good not Great

likes.liked: — nice pool and beach was like it was a private one
likes.disliked: — location too far from the town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The resort offers an ample number of lounge chairs - both at the pool area and at the beach. There is never any need to race out first thing in the morning to "claim" a chair and some space. And there is sufficient shade from beach palms to provide cover for even the most sun-adverse.
reviews.title: Only if you have to go to puerto rico...
No complaints!!!
reviews.text: The resort itself had only one observable flaw - it lacks sufficient dining options. There is a sit-down restaurant offering breakfast and dinner, and a pool-area snack bar offering lunch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: You would need deep pockets to consistently eat all dinners there as the lowest priced entree on the menu is $19 and there aren't any kid-friendly options on it. The breakfasts are much more reasonable - especially if you order off the menu (the $12 buffet seemed a little pricey). My family gave eight thumbs up to the panini-style breakfast sandwich of egg, ham and cheese. It was served with breakfast potatoes and was more than enough to feed two.
reviews.title: Great Experience!!
Zero Customer Service, Get a Clue
reviews.text: First off, I'd like to say that I am not a picky traveler. Give me a comfortable place to sleep that's free of lots of noise and bugs, and I'm fine. However, traveling with my wife and toddler changes things a bit...you need a hotel that can support your family's needs. The first night we arrived in ANASCO, not RINCON like the website and name of the resort imply, we were exhausted and just wanted to crash. Much to our dismay, the card for our room (the key) did not work. This should been a sign to leave immediately. After a few attempts and a new card, we were able to enter the room. The next day, we had to exchange cards about 5 times, the next day another 5 times and we started to complain, the next day we were so infuriated I actually had to raise my voice with the front desk in order for them to help out with the situation. To boot, the bathtub in our room would not fill up with water to give our daughter a bath. Rather than just change the room and throw us something for our troubles after the first 3 days of complaining, they played games with us "we'll have our repair man see to it, etc". Finally, I told the front desk that we NEED another room and that we need to be compensated for our headache. Our room was changed, but not ONCE did ANYONE offer to help us move all of our stuff (we had to move to a totally new building, mind you). After lugging all of our stuff to the new room, the DOOR STILL DID NOT OPEN. After arguing with the front desk and the repair guy again, we were allowed access to the adjoining suite next to our room. The lock on the suite door worked for the reminder of the stay and everything was fine. We were comped a free night, and we had use of the suite for th remainder of the trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of these problems could have been avoided and the hotel wouldn't have had to comp me anything if: the front desk gave us another room right from the start and did not play games with us. Another thing that could have helped would have been some common courtesy (ie help us move all our crap while moving to another room). All I have to say is GET A CLUE RINCON BEACH RESORT, you have a lot to learn about customer service. You'll never see us again, and we will spread the word.
reviews.title: Two Thumbs Up

likes.liked: — A great value for the money without feeling like we were in a budget hotel
likes.disliked: — The disappointing view from our balcony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in early May, and on the weekdays it was nearly empty. As you'll see in my photos, there were weekdays when we had the beach, pool, and hot tub all to ourselves. When going out to dinner, the local restaurants were equally quiet, so it seems that May is a great time to visit Rincon if you want to get away from other tourists. On the weekend, there were many more guests, but that was good too because they staffed the pool bar, brought in live music at dinner, and added outdoor seating at the restaurant. The restaurant on site was pricey but well worth it (just be sure to order off the menu and avoid the buffet). The photos you see at the Rincon Beach website are accurate as far as the pool, the views, and the outside areas of the property. The inside of our guest room was not as cute as their website would lead you to expect, but it was fine. The price was right, and the free parking was appreciated after having stayed in San Juan for a few nights. The beach was clean and safe. Be sure to rent a car as you're not within walking distance of anything. The only thing that disappointed us was that we paid extra for an oceanview room, but our room was tucked back in a corner with only a glimpse of the water. We were ok with that, because we didn't spend much time in the room anyway, but if the view is important to you, be sure to ask which way your balcony faces. Overall, we enjoyed our getaway at RBR much more than our time at a couple of pricier hotels back in San Juan.
reviews.title: 3 Star
Poor service
reviews.text: We wanted an inexpensive getaway for the holidays this year, and Rincon Beach Resort came up on Expedia, under the package deals that include flight and car rental. It was in our price range, so we decided to try it. The resort is really beautiful and was just what we were looking for. It is very relaxing, if you want to hang out at the pool. The restaurant is 5 star with a price to match. We thought it was worth it though, considering the room was priced very reasonably. The room itself is what makes this hotel a 3 star. There were small bugs on the counter every time I went into the bathroom, and as we were on the bottom floor, we kept waiting for a lizard or other creature to visit us through the gap under the door. The rest of the hotel was more like a 4 or 5 star though, and we weren't in the room much. Very friendly, helpful staff. We will visit again and request a room on one of the higher floors.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel has a great pool and is right on a VERY clean stretch of beach. Staff's service was underwelming. Good spot for a family w/ kids who's not to adventurous and is not looking for any variety but wants to stay put.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel but not the right groove for Rincon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Rincon Beach Resort was exactly as described on this forum. It really isn't so much of a resort as it is a nice hotel. The grounds are very beautiful and well maintained. Although the staff was not necessarily friendly, they were professional and responsive. Our base "garden level" room was much nicer and bigger than I expected. Further, it had a partial view out onto the beach. Although it may not have passed a cleanliness inspection at a luxury resort (I notice one small patch of mold on the ceiling in the corner of the bathroom), I think 95% of all people would consider it very clean.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

likes.liked: — Facilities are very nice and well maintained -- beach location is excellent!!!! -- good value compared to other places with similar accomodations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was very nice and clean and the entire pool area was impressive. Most of all, as the pictures show, the pool opens right onto the beach with a beautiful buffer of palms and newish beach loungers. The bar at the pool served delicious sandwiches and tropical drinks until about 6:00pm. The beach was as nice as advertised!!!!! The sand is not white, but it is beautiful and spotless! We strolled just south of the resort and had our own stretch of beach for 3 hours. The swimming would not be good for little children, but was great for competent swimmers.
reviews.title: VERY PLEASED WITH OUR STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were warned when checking in, that there was wedding on the property that would have a DJ playing until 11:00pm. It was great!!!! The DJ played a nice mix of pop and Latin music that added a fun atmosphere to the entire property. I think they should do this every night!
reviews.title: Very nice place, had to work to get the room / features we wanted

likes.disliked: — hotel staff who spoke Spanish in front of American guests (as if the staff were speaking in code)

reviews.title: Relaxing paradise
reviews.text: The property is a bit removed from Rincon - being several miles south on the very outskirt of the Rincon area. So, I don't think the Rincon Beach Resort is a good place to go if you plan on exploring Rincon in detail. However, it is a GREAT place to relax and was a really nice stop overnight for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon and was very suprised with the hotel. We had a delux ocean view with a king bed and the room was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful with our every need. I will say you must have a rental car if you want to take advantage of the surrounding activities due to the resorts location, but it was exactly what my new bride and I wanted. I would recommend this place to our friends and family.
reviews.title: Perfect for Families!

likes.disliked: — Not enough dining and snack options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel I guess would be good if you have small children or just want to be in a some what boring place. The good thing is that you are close to some of the most beutiful beaches in PR. But they are NO WHERE close to the hotel. You have to drive about 20 to 30 mintues to get to those. The food is good,the bartenders do not make the best drinks but they will get you drunk if that is what you want. The rooms are NICE nothing bad to say about those. The overall experiance is good if you are a older person or have small kids. Otherwise stay somewhere else. This is not the place for you!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: SO SO!!!!!

likes.disliked: — The area the hotel is in and the beach is VERY DARK compared to other parts of the island.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with our stay at the Rincon Beach Resort. We found the setting to be great - somewhat isolated but still close to the town, restaurants, etc. There was actually a really fun pool hall across the street we had a blast at! The pool area and beach were great, and we really liked the open-air lobby. The one note I would make it to be careful in selecting your room type. We chose a queen sofa bed room which actually ended up only having a queen sofa bed - in other words, no real bed. The room was still really nice with a full kitchen, dining room, living room, bathroom, just no bedroom. Apparently the adjoining room is the bedroom which you can rent in addition (for example, it would be great for a family) we just didn't know this ahead of time. It ended up not being a big deal though b/c the pull-out couch was pretty comfy. Plus, with such a nicely decorated room and ocean views from our windows we couldn't be too upset! Aside from that we ate breakfast at the restaurant there and found the food to be really good and very reasonably priced. A great stay!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I perused around the website in anticipation of our 5 night vacation last week. The website is completely deceiving. The rooms look NOTHING like they portay them to look. They all like a roadside Motel 6, equipped with the moldy smell, pea size shower head, old OLD looking hotel furniture, a large trash dump DIRECTLY outside the hotel room we were supposed to stay in, and neglectful customer service. When we arrived at 3 am (due to the 11:46 pm arrival on the Continental flight from Newark) the front desk guy didj't even bother to motion to help me (6 months pregnant) with the bags I was carrying, while my husband parked.
reviews.title: Never Ever Again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought I wold cry. I slept for 4 hours, woke up, checked out, got the refund for the remaining days, and ran to the amazing HORNED DORSET PRIMAVERA. You pay for the upgrade, but for a one time vacation, it is worth it!!!!
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, let me qualify my review by saying that due to flight issues, our stay here was cut to one night.
reviews.title: Loved Puerto Rico but had a brush with death in Rincon!!
